alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 7:50PM CST until January 28 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tombigbee River near Amory Tombigbee River at Bigbee Buttahatchie River near Aberdeen For the Tombigbee River...at Bigbee, and Amory...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Buttahatchie River...near Aberdeen...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River at Bigbee. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Water is flowing over portions of Hood Road and extensive agricultural flooding is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 16.7 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 800 AM CST.
